titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Souvenir Performance Program Collection
titlestmt.author: by Susan Brady

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Sunday December 9, 2018 at 05:22

did.unittitle: Souvenir performance program collection

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of souvenir performance programs, the majority of which document anniversary or other special performances of individual actors, theatrical productions, theatres, and theatrical production companies in the United States and Great Britain.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Yale Drama Library in 2007.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Souvenir Performance Program Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Souvenir Performance Program Collection. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of souvenir performance programs, the majority of which document anniversary or other special performances of individual actors, theatrical productions, theatres, and theatrical production companies in the United States and Great Britain. There are several souvenir programs documenting dance performances and films. Some of the programs are accompanied by additional related brochures, serial issues, broadsides, etc. The program formats include single sheet programs on paper, die-cut paper board, and silk. Multi-page publications include photographs, narrative biographies and histories of individuals, theatres, and plays, and reproductions of sets and costume designs. In addition to the souvenir programs, there are a small number of programs documenting recitals and dramatic readings; school performances; religious dramas; church services and concerts; and miscellaneous meetings, ceremonies, and exhibitions. The majority of the material dates from the late-nineteenth through the mid-twentieth century.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material is organized into eight series: Actors; Plays; Theatres; Theatre Companies; Dance Performances; Films; Recitals and Amateur Performances; and Ceremonies, Meetings, and Exhibitions.

did.unittitle: Actors

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of programs documenting anniversary, testimonial, benefit, and memorial performances and celebrations of individual actors. City, venue, and date of performance are provided when available, but since souvenir programs were often published for actors on tour to several cities they do not always identify city and venue.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of production.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of programs for specific productions, the majority of which document anniversary performances of a production. The city, venue, and date of performance are provided when available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains programs and other materials relating to openings, closings, anniversaries and other events of specific theatres.
